grid_specification.cell_format: Column letter + Row number (e.g., A1, B2, C3) - Columns run LEFT to RIGHT: A is leftmost, {last_col} is rightmost - Rows run TOP to BOTTOM: Row 1 is topmost, Row {rows} is bottommost
grid_specification.spatial_math: Each cell represents exactly 1/{cols} of image width and 1/{rows} of image height. - Cell width = {cell_width_pct}% of image width - Cell height = {cell_height_pct}% of image height Use this to validate your coordinates: - An element spanning 10 columns covers ~{ten_col_pct}% of page width - An element spanning 10 rows covers ~{ten_row_pct}% of page height - Content in the top quarter of the page should end by approximately row {quarter_row} - Content in the top third of the page should end by approximately row {third_row} - Content in the top half of the page should end by approximately row {half_row}
grid_specification.grid_visual_aids: The grid overlay includes: - Grid lines at each cell boundary - Major lines (darker) every 5 cells for easier counting - Edge labels showing cell coordinates - Symbols at regular intervals as visual landmarks Use these visual aids to precisely locate element boundaries.
